text: The AFC Women's Asian Cup is a women's association football tournament for teams in Asia. The most successful team is currently the China women's national football team with 8 titles. == Record == Year Host Final Third Place Match Winner Score Runner-up Third Place Score Fourth Place 1975 Details 3 – 1 5 – 0 1977 Details 3 – 1 2 – 0 1979 Details 2 – 0 (South) unknown Western Australia 1981 Details 5 – 0 2 – 0 1983 Details 3 – 0 0 – 0 (5–4) pen 1986 Details 2 – 0 3 – 0 1989 Details 1 – 0 3 – 1 1991 Details 5 – 0 0 – 0 (5–4) pen 1993 Details 3 – 0 3 – 0 1995 Details 2 – 0 0 – 0 (3–0) pen 1997 Details 2 – 0 2 – 0 1999 Details 3 – 0 3 – 2 2001 Details 2 – 0 8 – 0 2003 Details 2 – 1 aet 1 – 0 2006 Details 2 – 2 aet (4–2) pen 3 – 2 2008 Details 2 – 1 3 – 0 2010 Details 1 – 1 aet (5–4) pen 2 – 0 2014 Details 1 – 0 2 – 1 # Nation Winners Runners-up Third Place Fourth Place Total 1 align=left 8 2 2 1 13 2 align=left 3 3 2 1 9 3 align=left 3 2 2 2 9 4 align=left 1 4 5 3 13 5 align=left 1 3 1 0 5 6 align=left 1 2 1 2 6 7 align=left 1 0 0 0 1 8 align=left 0 2 1 0 3 9 align=left 0 0 1 3 4 10 align=left 0 0 1 2 3 11 align=left 0 0 1 1 2 11 align=left 0 0 1 1 2 13 align=left 0 0 0 2 2 Total Total 18 18 18 18 72 == References == == Other websites == *Official Website Category:Women's football Category:Sport in Asia
